intro: Phacelia neomexicana var. euneomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. This annual plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as cliffs and slopes. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and short life cycle. The plant plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
